text: hi guys I'm Laura Vitale on this episode
of Laura in the kitchen I'm going to
show you how to make graham cracker
crust at home now
I use graham cracker crust for a lot of
things and it's definitely one of those
things that's very convenient to buy at
the store it's already made but I'm
going to show you today how to make it
at home and it's super easy and I need
three ingredients which are ground F
graham crackers or you could use Moorea
crackers so unsalted butter room
temperature very important and a little
bit of sugar so it's not like you're
going to be it's a crazy ingredients you
can't find anywhere it's a basic
ingredients and I use a graham cracker
crust for a lot of things I've used it
for my banana cream pie I've used it for
my no-bake key lime pie and I'm going to
be using this one today
for a no big fruit tart that I'm making
so in the big bowl I'm just going to put
some up ground up graham crackers about
a cup and a half some sugar and I'm
going to add to that the unsalted butter
a very very soft room-temperature does
we want this to mix really well and then
just using a spatula you're going to
have just bring the whole thing together
until it forms like a dough consistency
this is pretty much perfect once you get
to this consistency you just take your
fingers and you squeeze it if it holds
together you're done now I'm going to be
using it as a like I said I'm going to
be using as um a no-bake fruit tart
whoops got some on me I'm making a mess
today so I'm putting this into a
nine-inch a tart pan with a removable
bottom but you can press this in a just
a 9 inch pie plate would work perfectly
so just using your fingers I'm just
going to press this nice and tight all
over it nice and evenly just using the
bottom of like a measuring cup or
ramekin or drinking glass just going to
press it to make sure it's nice and
tight and we have so much butter in
there that we don't have to butter this
or anything there we go this is it this
is done now all you would have to do is
let this cool for about an hour so that
the butter can harden up again and it
will keep it together otherwise if you
want to cut it up
fall apart but this is it this is how
you make your very own graham cracker
crust at home in absolutely minutes and
it's a great base for a lot of different
things and for today it's going to be a
no big fruit tart but I tell you guys
all about that in another video I hope
you guys enjoy spending time with me to
give this easy and quick recipe and
other recipes check out my website it's
www.h com
today's Twitter question comes from
Fiorina they asked where did you find
your inspiration for fresh and exciting
recipes to be honest with you I love
cooking I think about it all the time
I'm probably a big nerd when it comes to
it because everything to me is an
inspiration what I love to do is sort of
brainstorm and get great ideas I don't
like to go food shopping with a list of
sort of like recipes I'm gonna make that
week I don't do that
I go to the store and to the farmers
market and whatever's fresh whatever is
in season speaks to me and that's kind
of where I get my ideas like if
zucchinis in season oh I know I can
grill it I know I can marinate it and
what I can do so much with it if squash
is in season oh I would make a delicious
soup you name it but that's really where
I come up with recipes and I also think
a lot about family recipes and how can
change them up a little bit um but
that's really about it I mean I love
cooking all the time and I'm kind of I
always have a lot of ideas and I kind of
need to stop myself sometimes because I
feel like what brain is gonna explode
with recipes so if you have any
questions for me you like to ask and you
